etymology.description: 藕(藕) (ǒu, "lotus root") + 粉(粉) (fěn, "powder") = lotus root starch
etymology.interpretation: 藕粉(藕粉) (ǒufěn, "lotus root starch") is a powder derived from the lotus root, a common ingredient used in Chinese cuisine for its nutritional benefits and unique texture. Mixing 藕(藕) (ǒu, "lotus root") with 粉(粉) (fěn, "powder") aptly describes the product.

examples.chinese: 我买了藕粉(我買了藕粉)。
妈妈用藕粉(媽媽用藕粉)，做出了美味的汤圆(做出了美味的湯圓)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā yòng ǒufěn, zuò chūle měiwèi de tāngyuán.
examples.english: Mom used lotus root starch to make delicious glutinous rice balls.

examples.chinese: 藕粉可以用来增稠(藕粉可以用來增稠)，调制传统的甜品(調制傳統的甜品)。
examples.pinyin: Ǒufěn kěyǐ yòng lái zēngchóu, tiáozhì chuántǒng de tiánpǐn.
examples.english: Lotus root starch can be used as a thickener to prepare traditional desserts.
